Post.title: Guided Filter
Post._content:
# 

Guided Fliter guidance image  guidance image  O(N) 

![ae96c131-4f9b-4935-ba60-0d01c73db384](ae96c131-4f9b-4935-ba60-0d01c73db384.png)



# 

- **Explicit Weighted-Average Filters**

gradient reversal  artifactGaussian  weighed average  brute-force  O(Nr^2)  O(Nlogr)  O(N) coarse samplingNyquist  condition Edge-Avoiding WaveletsDomain  Transform Filter

- **Implicit Weighted-Average Filters **

 optimization-based 

- **Non-average Filters **

  Total-Variation filters



# Guided Filter

bilateralPreserves edges, but not gradients

![img](v2-4fefe1babc940218364d62939dac34c5_720w.webp)



$$ O_i = a_k G_i + b_k, \forall i \in \omega_k $$

$$ O_i = I_i - n_i $$

$I$ $G$ $O$  $G$ k $\omega_k$  $a_k$, $b_k$ $I$  $O$   $I = O + n$ 

 $O$  $I$  linear ridge regression

$$ E(a_k, b_k) = \sum_{i \ in \omega_k}((a_k G_i + b_k - I_i)^2 + \epsilon a_k^2) $$

 $a_k$  $b_k$ windowwindow

$$ a_k = \frac{Cov(G_k, I_k)}{Var(G_k) + \epsilon}, \quad b_k = \bar{I_k} - a_k\bar{G_k} $$



![img](v2-8b44dad903656926a0748acaa5530d56_720w.webp)

 $f_{mean}$ r

![guided_filter_param_influence](guided_filter_param_influence.png)

slidepinputIqIGOinputguidanceoutput

 $I$  $G$  $a_k$  $\epsilon$$b_k$  $(1 - a_k)$ 



- **0$a_k$  0  $b_k$ 1,  $O_k =  mean(I_k)pixel**



- **$a_k$  cov  var$\epsilon$  $b_k$ **



GFBFGFBFPSNR**It is often considered as visually insensitive when the PSNR >= 40 dB **



![53f6dff9-5487-4004-8fb7-30c1c0820353](53f6dff9-5487-4004-8fb7-30c1c0820353.png)

BFslopeslopeslopeslopeslopedetailartifactenhanceGF

GFInterestingly, the  guided filter is not simply a smoothing filter. Due to the local linear  model of q = aI+b, the output q is locally a scaling (plus an offset) of the guidance I. This makes it possible to transfer structure from the  guidance I to the output q, even if the filtering input p is  smoothfeathering/matting  dehazing 



# 

fmean2r+11Dpixelpixel r=2  fmean(5) = f(3) + f(4) + f(5) + f(6) + f(7) fmean(6) = f(4) +  f(5) + f(6) + f(7) + f(8)  fmean(6) = fmean(5) - f(3) + f(8)  r

![v2-69114b7134b01dfb5e99495fd394b49a_720w](v2-69114b7134b01dfb5e99495fd394b49a_720w.png)

GF ab I  O(N)  O(N/s^2) s



![v2-199c95da139938b1f178c73c0099f553_720w](v2-199c95da139938b1f178c73c0099f553_720w.webp)



# 

 radius $epsilon$  $epsilon$ guidanceinputguidancesoft threshold



# 

guidancemaskguidance $a_k$  $b_k$ 



$$ O_k = \bar{I_k} + a_k (G_k - \bar{G_k}) $$



$$ a_k = \frac{cov(I_k, G_k)}{var(I_k) + \epsilon} $$

guidancedetail



$$O_k = \bar{I_k} + a_k (I_k - \bar{I_k}) = \bar{I_k} + a_k I_{detail} $$



$$ a_k = \frac{var(I_k)}{var(I_k) + \epsilon} $$

$a_k$ $a_k$ 1+$a_k$0



# reference

[1] K. He, J. Sun, and X. Tang. Guided image filtering. In ECCV, pages 114. 2010.

[2] K. He, J. Sun, and X. Tang. Guided image filtering. TPAMI, 35(6):13971409, 2013

[3] He K, Sun J. Fast Guided Filter[J]. Computer Science, 2015.

[4] https://kaiminghe.github.io/eccv10/eccv10ppt.pdf



> 2017/12/22 Fri 14:34 version 1 
>
> 2023/01/04 Wed 21:02 version 2 guide

bilateralPreserves edges, but not gradients

$$ O_i = a_k G_i + b_k, \forall i \in \omega_k $$

$$ O_i = I_i - n_i $$

$I$ $G$ $O$  $G$ k $\omega_k$  $a_k$, $b_k$ $I$  $O$   $I = O + n$ 

 $O$  $I$  linear ridge regression

$$ E(a_k, b_k) = \sum_{i \ in \omega_k}((a_k G_i + b_k - I_i)^2 + \epsilon a_k^2) $$

 $a_k$  $b_k$ windowwindow

![img](v2-8b44dad903656926a0748acaa5530d56_720w.webp)

BFslopeslopeslopeslopeslopedetailartifactenhanceGF

GFInterestingly, the  guided filter is not simply a smoothing filter. Due to the local linear  model of q = aI+b, the output q is locally a scaling (plus an offset) of the guidance I. This makes it possible to transfer structure from the  guidance I to the output q, even if the filtering input p is  smoothfeathering/matting  dehazing

fmean2r+11Dpixelpixel r=2  fmean(5) = f(3) + f(4) + f(5) + f(6) + f(7) fmean(6) = f(4) +  f(5) + f(6) + f(7) + f(8)  fmean(6) = fmean(5) - f(3) + f(8)  r

![v2-199c95da139938b1f178c73c0099f553_720w](v2-199c95da139938b1f178c73c0099f553_720w.webp)

 radius $epsilon$  $epsilon$ guidanceinputguidancesoft threshold

guidancedetail



$$O_k = \bar{I_k} + a_k (I_k - \bar{I_k}) = \bar{I_k} + a_k I_{detail} $$



$$ a_k = \frac{var(I_k)}{var(I_k) + \epsilon} $$

$a_k$ $a_k$ 1+$a_k$0

Guided Fliter guidance image guidance image O(N)

  • Explicit Weighted-Average Filters

gradient reversal artifactGaussian weighed average brute-force O(Nr^2) O(Nlogr) O(N) coarse samplingNyquist condition Edge-Avoiding WaveletsDomain Transform Filter

  • Implicit Weighted-Average Filters

optimization-based

  • Non-average Filters

Total-Variation filters

Guided Filter

bilateralPreserves edges, but not gradients

$$ O_i = a_k G_i + b_k, \forall i \in \omega_k $$

$$ O_i = I_i - n_i $$

$I$ $G$ $O$ $G$ k $\omega_k$ $a_k$, $b_k$ $I$ $O$ $I = O + n$

$O$ $I$ linear ridge regression

$$ E(a_k, b_k) = \sum_{i \ in \omega_k}((a_k G_i + b_k - I_i)^2 + \epsilon a_k^2) $$

$a_k$ $b_k$ windowwindow

$$ a_k = \frac{Cov(G_k, I_k)}{Var(G_k) + \epsilon}, \quad b_k = \bar{I_k} - a_k\bar{G_k} $$

$f_{mean}$ r

slidepinputIqIGOinputguidanceoutput

$I$ $G$ $a_k$ $\epsilon$$b_k$ $(1 - a_k)$

  • 0$a_k$ 0 $b_k$ 1, $O_k = mean(I_k)pixel

  • $a_k$ cov var$\epsilon$ $b_k$

GFBFGFBFPSNRIt is often considered as visually insensitive when the PSNR >= 40 dB

BFslopeslopeslopeslopeslopedetailartifactenhanceGF

GFInterestingly, the guided filter is not simply a smoothing filter. Due to the local linear model of q = aI+b, the output q is locally a scaling (plus an offset) of the guidance I. This makes it possible to transfer structure from the guidance I to the output q, even if the filtering input p is smoothfeathering/matting dehazing

fmean2r+11Dpixelpixel r=2 fmean(5) = f(3) + f(4) + f(5) + f(6) + f(7) fmean(6) = f(4) + f(5) + f(6) + f(7) + f(8) fmean(6) = fmean(5) - f(3) + f(8) r

guidancemaskguidance $a_k$ $b_k$

$$ O_k = \bar{I_k} + a_k (G_k - \bar{G_k}) $$

$$ a_k = \frac{cov(I_k, G_k)}{var(I_k) + \epsilon} $$

guidancedetail

$$O_k = \bar{I_k} + a_k (I_k - \bar{I_k}) = \bar{I_k} + a_k I_{detail} $$

$$ a_k = \frac{var(I_k)}{var(I_k) + \epsilon} $$

$a_k$ $a_k$ 1+$a_k$0
